job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
COVID-19 Update: At FDM, it’s ‘business as usual’, we are recruiting now and throughout the year. Due to COVID-19, we have implemented alternative working arrangements to ensure that all our people stay safe. These consist of remote working, virtual training, video interviewing, and access to webinars and virtual events. We have training start dates happening throughout the year. If you’re looking to start your career in technology or business, we want to hear from you now!


Are you looking for a fast-paced and varied career, where you’ll be a critical component to keeping business systems running? If you think a career in tech is just about coding, think again. A career in technical operations is essential to supporting an organization’s business objectives.


At FDM, our TechOps training will prepare you to progress in various roles including Site Reliability Engineering, Cyber Security Engineering, DevOps, Cloud Engineering and Application Support.


FDM is an award-winning graduate employer. We recruit, train and deploy talented individuals, like yourself, who want to excel in a successful technical career. Following training, you’ll gain two years of commercial experience on client site across the US. It doesn’t stop there, many of our consultants go on to work permanently with the client, work internally at FDM or choose a different pathway using the connections and experience they’ve gained.


What We Offer You:


· Industry recognized paid training and assignment with one of FDM’s global clients

· Comprehensive benefits including; Medical, Dental & Vision, 401K & Company Match, and PTO

· Ongoing training and development through FDM mentors and virtual learning

· Relocation support where applicable for training and assignment(s)

Sound good? Find out more about who we are and watch this video.


The ideal FDMer has:


· Bachelor’s degree or above

· A strong aptitude for IT and the interest and drive to expand your IT skill set

· An analytical mindset and problem solving abilities

· Eager, ambitious, and adaptable to change

· Eligible to work in The United States

· Geographically flexible throughout the US to support our clients

· Able to commit to a two-year contract with FDM upon completion of the training period


Culture and Diversity


At FDM, our culture is unique. From charity partnerships to networking events, we are proud to provide a range of opportunities for you to get involved, broaden your networks and help you build relationships. In 2018 we were awarded Diversity Employer of the Year and we continue to prove that we’re inclusive by nature through our initiatives including Women in Tech.


FDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.
